bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, November 22, 1898

div1.p: Lawrence Reed will leave for Cuba tomorrow.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, November 22, 1898
div1.p:
I suppose this will be my last
chance to drop you a line before I go and
perhaps it will be the last you will have
from me for a while, Every thing is packed
and we are living, just as we do in heavy
marching order. That is from our Knap Sacks.
all our lockers and boxes we turned in
yesterday and they are all stored away.
Of course we cant say when we will
go, but we expect to go tomorrow,
I am trying to guess where I will spend
my 21st birthday, may be in Cuba-

The post is wild with excitement and
every body is rushing here & there and
I tell you its fine, Realy I would
write more but there is so much for me to do
and as there is not much to say I will close.
Dont forget to send me a nice box
when we get into camp for I am sure
It will come in very nicely --

Said goodbye to the Weavers the other day.
Harry Connor (a Geotown) fellow who used
to live with the Wilsons was down to see
me sunday. had a fine time with him

Give my love to all the
people and write me as soon as you
get my address
div1.closer:
Aff Lawrence We just got a telegram to
leave Boston at 6. P.M. tomorrow
Hurrah
